concept.title: Saving a SQL Query as a Report

conbody.p: You can create reports using the contents of the SQL query which you have prepared in the workbench.
To edit and save a query as a report:

ol.li:
In the SQL Workbench screen, click the Edit as a report button.
Figure 7-7: Edit Query as a Report:
The SQL Query Report Settings screen is displayed.
Figure 7-8: SQL Query Report Settings

As shown in the Figure 7-8, click Add a Run Time SQL Parameter button to add parameters in the SQL. Click the button multiple times to add more tokens, as shown in the figure below.
Figure 7-9: Add Run Time SQL Parameter
To edit the token, double-click on the parameters under the Label column. When edited, make sure that any changes are reflected in the SQL.

If you select a date range in the Data Limits tab, you may also use the tokens :start and :end to reference those dates. Add quotes around the token if SQL requires quotes for the data type. Example: select columnA, columnB from schema.table where columnA = ':stringToken').
Click Save Report button. For more information on running a report, and adding charts, see and see .
